org.kepler.util.sql

Class Column

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.util.sql.Column

  • public class Column
extends java.lang.Object
    A generic representation of an SQL column.
    Author:
    Daniel Crawl

      Construct a Column with a type and type length.

      Construct a Column with a type and type length, and specifying if can be null or a primary key.

      Construct a Column with a type and a default value.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultValue

        public java.lang.String getDefaultValue()
        Get the default value. Returns null if none exists.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Get the length of the column's type. Returns -1 if not specified.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name. If the column has not been added to a table, returns null.

      • getTable

        public Table getTable()
        Get the containing table. If the column has not been added to a, then return null.

      • getType

        public Column.Type getType()
        Get the data type.

      • isAutoIncrement

        public boolean isAutoIncrement()
        Returns true if column value is auto-incremented.

      • isNullAllowed

        public boolean isNullAllowed()
        Returns true if column can have null values.

      • isPrimaryKey

        public boolean isPrimaryKey()
        Returns true if column is primary key.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name.

        Get a string representation of the column.
